page.title: 01Description of the Area
page.content: {Trefriw and Maenan} This area shows considerable diversity of terrain,from valley floor at little above sea level to rocky uplands over 450m.The two sides of the valley are different,marking a fault line. On the Trefriw side are steep and precipitous outliers of the Carneddau,whilst the Maenan side has gentler more fertile slopes leading towards the Hiraethog or Denbigh Moors. The area to the West of road B5106 is within the Snowdonia National park and subject to its amenities regulations, so that roof repairs must be of slate in keeping with the predominant style of this slate producing region. Adjacent areas provide excellent walking terrain,fishing,and water sports.
